dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So OpenAI is now officially on the hook for the Google tax in Kazakhstan—what does that actually mean for them?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So OpenAI is now officially on the hook for the Google tax in Kazakhstan-what does that actually mean for them?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The State Revenue Committee has announced the registration of the American company OpenAI, developer of the popular AI chatbot ChatGPT, under the so-called "Google tax" framework.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it means that as of May 2025, they'll have to pay value-added tax on any services they provide to individual users in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it means that as of May twenty twenty five, they'll have to pay value-added tax on any services they provide to individual users in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As of May 2025, OpenAI, L.L.C. has been officially included in the list of conditionally registered foreign providers of digital services that offer paid services to users in Kazakhstan. This means the company will now pay value-added tax (VAT) on services provided to individuals in Kazakhstan, in accordance with local tax legislation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and this Google tax has been around since, uh, 2022, right? It's not exactly new.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and this Google tax has been around since, uh, twenty twenty two, right? It's not exactly new.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The committee reminded that the "Google tax" has been in effect in Kazakhstan since 2022 and is aimed at ensuring fair taxation of multinational IT companies operating in the country's digital market.

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's been in place for a few years now. It's aimed at making sure these big multinational tech companies pay their fair share locally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's been in place for a few years now. It's aimed at making sure these big multinational tech companies pay their fair share locally.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The committee reminded that the "Google tax" has been in effect in Kazakhstan since 2022 and is aimed at ensuring fair taxation of multinational IT companies operating in the country's digital market.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But OpenAI isn't like Google or Facebook—it's an AI service. Do you think this kind of tax could slow down their expansion?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB

dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, it might add a layer of complexity, but honestly, most of these companies just factor it into their pricing or operations. They're used to navigating different tax regimes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
